Main class: Gitana¶

class gitana.gitana.Gitana(config, log_folder_path=None)[source]¶

This is the main class you instanciate to use Gitana functionalities

add_forum_tables(db_name)[source]¶
Parameters:db_name (str) – the name of the DB to initialize

initializes forum tables if they do not exist

Parameters:db_name (str) – the name of the DB to initialize

initializes git tables if they do not exist

Parameters:db_name (str) – the name of the DB to initialize

initializes instant messaging tables if they do not exist

Parameters:db_name (str) – the name of the DB to initialize

initializes issue tracker tables if they do not exist

create_log_folder(name)[source]¶

creates the log folder

Parameters:name (str) – the log folder path
create_project(db_name, project_name)[source]¶

inserts a project in the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of the project to create. It cannot be null
create_repository(db_name, project_name, repo_name)[source]¶

inserts a repository in the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project
  • repo_name (str) – the name of the repository to insert
delete_previous_logs()[source]¶

deletes the content of the log folder

export_activity_report(db_name, settings_path, output_path)[source]¶

exports the data stored in the Gitana DB to an HTML report

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • settings_path (str) – the path of the JSON that drives the export process
  • output_path (str) – the path where to export the report
export_graph(db_name, settings_path, output_path)[source]¶

exports the data stored in the Gitana DB to a graph (gexf format)

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • settings_path (str) – the path of the JSON that drives the export process
  • output_path (str) – the path where to export the graph
extract_dependency_relations(db_name, project_name, repo_name, git_repo_path, git_references=[], extra_paths=[])[source]¶
Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB. It cannot be null
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • repo_name (str) – the name of an existing repository in the DB. It cannot be null
  • git_repo_path (str) – the local path of the repository. It cannot be null
  • git_references (list) – list of git references to load dependency info. By default all.
  • extra_paths (list) – list of additional directory paths inside git repo to look for target files.
import_bugzilla_issue_data(db_name, project_name, repo_name, issue_tracker_name, url, product, before_date=None, processes=3)[source]¶

imports Bugzilla issue data to the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • repo_name (str) – the name of an existing repository in the DB
  • issue_tracker_name (str) – the name of the issue tracker to import. It cannot be null
  • url (str) – the URL of the issue tracker. It cannot be null
  • product (str) – the name of the product used in the issue tracker. It cannot be null
  • before_date (str) – import data before date (YYYY-mm-dd). It can be null
  • processes (int) – number of processes to import the data. If null, the default number of processes is used (3)
import_eclipse_forum_data(db_name, project_name, forum_name, eclipse_forum_url, before_date=None, processes=2)[source]¶

imports Eclipse forum data to the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • forum_name (str) – the name of the forum to import. It cannot be null
  • eclipse_forum_url (str) – the URL of the forum. It cannot be null
  • before_date (str) – import data before date (YYYY-mm-dd). It can be null
  • processes (int) – number of processes to import the data. If null, the default number of processes is used (2)
import_git_data(db_name, project_name, repo_name, git_repo_path, import_type=1, references=None, before_date=None, processes=5)[source]¶

imports Git data to the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • repo_name (str) – the name of the repository to import. It cannot be null
  • git_repo_path (str) – the local path of the repository. It cannot be null
  • import_type (int) – 1 = do not import patch content, 2 = import patch content but not at line level, 3 = import patch content at line level, the default type will be 1
  • references (list str) – list of references (branches and tags) to import. It can be null or [“ref-name-1”, .., “ref-name-n”]
  • before_date (str) – import data before date (YYYY-mm-dd). It can be null
  • processes (int) – number of processes to import the data. If null, the default number of processes is used (5)
import_github_issue_data(db_name, project_name, repo_name, issue_tracker_name, github_repo_full_name, tokens, before_date=None)[source]¶

imports GitHub issue data to the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • repo_name (str) – the name of an existing repository in the DB
  • issue_tracker_name (str) – the name of the issue tracker to import. It cannot be null
  • github_repo_full_name (str) – full name of the GitHub repository. It cannot be null
  • tokens (list str) – list of GitHub tokens. It cannot be null
  • before_date (str) – import data before date (YYYY-mm-dd). It can be null
import_slack_data(db_name, project_name, instant_messaging_name, tokens, before_date=None, channels=None)[source]¶

imports Slack data to the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • instant_messaging_name (str) – the name of the instant messaging to import. It cannot be null
  • tokens (list str) – list of Slack tokens. It cannot be null
  • before_date (str) – import data before date (YYYY-mm-dd). It can be null
  • channels (list str) – list of channels to import. It can be null or [“channel-name-1”, .., “channel-name-n”]
import_stackoverflow_data(db_name, project_name, forum_name, search_query, tokens, before_date=None)[source]¶

imports Stackoverflow data to the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • forum_name (str) – the name of the forum to import. It cannot be null
  • search_query (str) – retrieves Stackoverflow questions labeled with a given string. It cannot be null
  • tokens (list str) – list of Stackoverflow tokens. It cannot be null
  • before_date (str) – import data before date (YYYY-mm-dd). It can be null
init_db(db_name, init_git=True, init_issue_tracker=True, init_forum=True, init_instant_messaging=True)[source]¶

initializes the Gitana DB schema

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of the DB to initialize
  • init_git (bool) – if True, it initializes the tables containing git data
  • init_issue_tracker (bool) – if True, it initializes the tables containing issue tracker data
  • init_forum (bool) – if True, it initializes the tables containing forum data
  • init_instant_messaging (bool) – if True, it initializes the tables containing instant messaging data
list_projects(db_name)[source]¶

lists all projects contained in the DB

Parameters:db_name (str) – the name of the DB
update_bugzilla_issue_data(db_name, project_name, repo_name, issue_tracker_name, url, product, processes=3)[source]¶

updates the Bugzilla issue data stored in the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • repo_name (str) – the name of an existing repository in the DB
  • issue_tracker_name (str) – the name of an existing issue tracker in the DB to update
  • url (str) – the URL of the issue tracker. It cannot be null
  • product (str) – the name of the product used in the issue tracker. It cannot be null
  • processes (int) – number of processes to import the data. If null, the default number of processes is used (3)
update_eclipse_forum_data(db_name, project_name, forum_name, eclipse_forum_url, processes=2)[source]¶

updates the Eclipse forum data stored in the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • forum_name (str) – the name of an existing forum in the DB to update
  • eclipse_forum_url (str) – the URL of the forum. It cannot be null
  • processes (int) – number of processes to import the data. If null, the default number of processes is used (2)
update_git_data(db_name, project_name, repo_name, git_repo_path, before_date=None, processes=5)[source]¶

updates the Git data stored in the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • repo_name (str) – the name of an existing repository in the DB to update
  • git_repo_path (str) – the path of the repository. It cannot be null
  • before_date (str) – import data before date (YYYY-mm-dd). It can be null
  • processes (int) – number of processes to import the data. If null, the default number of processes is used (5)
update_github_issue_data(db_name, project_name, repo_name, issue_tracker_name, github_repo_full_name, tokens)[source]¶

updates GitHub issue data stored in the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • repo_name (str) – the name of an existing repository in the DB
  • issue_tracker_name (str) – the name of an existing issue tracker to update
  • github_repo_full_name (str) – full name of the GitHub repository. It cannot be null
  • tokens (list str) – list of GitHub tokens. It cannot be null

updates Slack data stored in the DB

Parameters:
  • db_name (str) – the name of an existing DB
  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • instant_messaging_name (str) – the name of an existing instant messaging in the DB to update
  • tokens (list str) – list of Slack tokens. It cannot be null

Parameters:

  • project_name (str) – the name of an existing project in the DB
  • forum_name (str) – the name of an existing forum in the DB to update
  • tokens (list str) – list of Stackoverflow tokens. It cannot be null
